page.title: 12Links between villages
page.content: Communications depends largely on the telephone in these rural communities with the postal services to a much lesser extent.A few farmers now have C.B radios to communicate with the workforce.A few households on the southern edge of the area are in the Peterborough telephone area with a Loveden code which is based over the border in Lincolnshire.The rest of the area is in the Nottingham system with Whatton codes for Alverton,Flawborough and Thoroton whilst Shelton has a Newark code.The area is served by 3 different postal sorting offices.The only post office is in Shelton but all villages are served with a daily delivery and two postal collections. Local radio is a popular communication ,many residents using the 2 Nottingham stations for news,weather and travel reports.
